attributes.comment:
Dear Sir/Madam--I'm writing to express my dismay in hearing of your proposal to
increase fees for the I-171 process and the required fingerprinting fees. While
waiting for the referral for our second adopted child, we already will be required to
go through this process twice--not because of the requirements of the country
from which we are adopting, but because of the time line for the US policies
regarding the expiration of these documents. The process already is incredibly
cumbersome and inconvenient, depending on where one lives, and I find myself
asking what we, the US citizens and tax payers, could possibley gain by
increased fees for this process . After sitting for 2 hours each time at the local
BCIS office -2 hours away from our home-with a scheduled appointment time that
has never been met on the 3 different occasions we have had to go there (soon to
be 4), I'm highly skeptical that a higher fee would help the inefficient process. We
are not opposed to paying a fee, but we also lose an entire work day each time
we must go through this process. Instead of feeling good about our government's
efforts to enforce immigration laws, we have left feeling apalled about the
ineffiencies and wondering how this process has made anyone any safer.
If you must increase your fees, then please, please consider the extension of the
expiration time line for these special circumstances.
Thank you.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
